Standard types

This page explains the standardized matrix formats for all functions.

Points

Points lists, or single point coordinates are defined as Nx3 double matrix. Example: 
points = [ x1 y1 z1;
           x2 y2 z2;
           x3 y3 z3;
            .  .  .
           xn yn zn];

3D vectors for quiver plot use the same format (Nx1 or 1xM).

Labels

Labels are single column or single line vectors (both formats valid). 
labels = [1 2 3 4 5];

Volumes

Volumes are defined as 3 dimensional matrices. Matlab datatype can be "single" or "double".

Color Lookup Tables

Color lookup tables use a 4 column format. The first column contains the value that should be mapped, the following three columns contain normalized (0..1) rgb values. 
colorMap = [15.3 0.1 0.1 0.1;  % gray for value 15.3
            30.4 0   0.6 0.6;  % yellow for 30.4
            70.3 1   0   0;    % 70.3 is red
           ];
Colors for the values between the specified ones are interpolated.

Named Lookup Tables
in the base directory, there is a LUTlist.mat file, from which the named lookup tables are loaded. LUTlist is a struct, containing a struct for each color/opacity LUT pair. The name of the struct field is the LUT's name. Each LUT is a struct itself, having a field "colorLUT" for colors and "opacityLUT" for opacity table.
    LUTlist.
            SoftSkinII.
                       colorLUT
                       opacityLUT
            Airways.
                    colorLUT
                    opacityLUT
            [...]
The default lookup table is "SoftSkinII".

Opacity Lookup Tables

Opacity LUTs are 2 column matrices. The first column contains the data value, the second the opacity value.

Attention:
Opacity specifies how much light gets absorbed. It is the opposite of an alpha transparency value, therefore opacity = 1 - alpha.
opacityLUT = [1 0  ;   % value 1 is fully transparent
              2 0.5;   % value 2 is half transparent
              3 1.0   % value 3 is completely opaque
             ];
